steps: Check parent process of PowerShell execution
Look for obfuscation (Base64, IEX, long strings)
Pivot on user account and host for related activity
Check if failures come from the same IP or user
Identify if login eventually succeeded
Correlate with geolocation or impossible travel
Look for process access requests to lsass.exe
Check parent process (often cmd.exe or powershell.exe)
Correlate with account privilege levels
Identify unusual DLL paths loaded by rundll32
Check command-line arguments for suspicious export functions
Trace execution chain back to originating user or script
Check newly installed or modified services
Verify binary path and digital signatures
Correlate with persistence attempts
Decode Base64 command (look for -enc or -EncodedCommand)
Check for IEX (Invoke-Expression) usage
Correlate with network connections after execution
Check destination IP/port and reputation
Look for periodic beaconing behavior
Correlate with process initiating the connection
